Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory723.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Spooner', 3: 'I suppose this is a warm welcome for us, then?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Spooner punches through half of the face of the ominous stone lion. The passage falls quiet once more.'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'These mechanoids are quite old and severely weathered. Some even have moss growing on them.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hanying', 3: "I've never seen a model like this... At least not on the Nighter.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: "I'm sure there's a reason for that.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Spooner continues raking through the remnants on the passage as he passes Hanying a rusted component.'}
{3: "Inscribed on the tarnished metal are two tiny lines of Kowloong's ancient script and numbers. It is impossible to decipher the letters now covered in rust."}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'This should be the ID tag installed inside the mechanoid when it was first manufactured.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: "That's probably what it is, but check the other side.", 4: '2'}
{3: "Spooner flips the part in Hanying's hand to reveal a bundle of colorful new wires."}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'These were clearly added during a recent modification, and there are signs of older modifications underneath.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'Not only that, the modifications of each of these mechanoid look different.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'If all they did was modify, this scheme is rather crude.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'This must be the work of "The Cradle".', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'Maybe we could extract data about "The Cradle" from their memory shells, even if it\'s just information about this mountain...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'No luck. None of these mechanoids... have an intact storage unit.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'In place of a storage unit, they all have a transmitting device. There is no doubt that they are being controlled.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'A tool does not need to think.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: '...You asked me earlier whether I hate humans.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: "I did, but I thought you might have your reasons, so I didn't push it.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'Each member of the Church has their unique stories. As for me, I escaped from humans many, many years ago.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'In that arena, I was forced to fight mechanoids day in and day out by the owners of the ring. I was even forced to fight... humans.', 4: '2'}

{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'The "audience" wanted nothing but bloodshed and flying wreckage, but that was my only chance of survival. For the humans, I was nothing but a tool for them to satisfy their lust for blood.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'Even now, some humans still think that way. The remains scattered here are the best proof.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Spooner puts down the fragment in his hand and breathes out a heavy sigh.'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: "Mechanoid... aren't supposed to have cognition, are they?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'All those years ago, my creator saw me as nothing more than a tool, too, with no need for cognition.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'Your creator... is probably from Kowloong as well.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'Correct.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'Do you remember your maker?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: "I don't know his name, but I'm pretty sure I'd recognize his face if I saw him.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'Mechanoids do not forget. As long as we have a compatible storage unit, our memory shell will forever store the endless flow of time.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'Compared to mortals who will inevitably forget, this is a rather cruel advantage.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'I... was forsaken by my creator.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: "I failed to meet his expectations, to realize his wishes. I didn't even have a name.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'The day my maker left Kowloong, I was locked away, completely and utterly abandoned.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'That means he never recognized you as his creation.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'Zavier once told me that, "A maker must name their creation." Apparently, that is an established rule among humans.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: "That's why Zavier gives all sorts of bizarre names to each of the gadgets he's designed.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'If a maker refuses to name their creation, that would mean they do not recognize it as theirs.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'Villier never once acknowledged the meaning of my existence.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: "I don't see anything bad about that.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: "The meaning of our existence doesn't depend on our makers.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'I would say that for us, our creators are just indelible codes from the past that were engraved into our memory shells.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'Nothing more, and nothing less.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'It is true that I did not find the meaning of my life from my creator.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'Perhaps there really is a man-made, beating "heart" in my chest.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'My maker wasn\'t my motivation to go out to look for a "heart" when I was ready to do so.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: '...And I presume this human by the name of "Yoyo" is your motivation?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'Well... I suppose.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'Did this "Yoyo" also give you your name?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: "No, I found this title in an ancient Kowloong text myself. It wasn't even meant to be a name.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'I\'ve never imagined myself to ever "possess" a "name."', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'But she told me that that\'s my name, that it\'s "a name that only belongs to me."', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'At that moment, for the first time, I truly owned something.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: '...Sounds like she means a lot to you.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: '"Hierophant" once said that each mechanoid had two births.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'The first one is when it is assembled—that is the birth of the body. The second is the emergence of its consciousness at awakening.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'In that sense... maybe "Yoyo" was the key to your awakening.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Hanying nods softly as she peers into the misty clouds in the distance weaving through the rocky spires.'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'Nonetheless, Villier is still my creator.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She gazes at her hands, wordlessly questioning all the expectations and resentments borne by this body.'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'I will never deny that.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: "...Sorry for reminding you of difficult times. I'm not very good at talking about profound topics like this.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: "No, it's fine.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'You said so yourself, every member of the Church has its own unique story.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: "What're you...", 4: '2'}
{3: 'With a gentle smile, Hanying nods.'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'I just wanted to fulfill my past promise first. Nothing more.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'Because... I am probably no longer welcomed on the Nighter—or Kowloong, for that matter—anymore.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Hanying', 3: "Whether it is to repay the Sagemachina for awakening me, or for all the help I have received from the Church, I will eventually accept Arcana's invitation and contribute what I can to the Church.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: 'The Church of Machina welcomes you. Arcana would be overjoyed to hear that.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: "Perhaps I shouldn't say this, but I truly felt at home at the Church of Machina.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'And I only ever felt that way when I spent time with Yoyo.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: "We can talk about anything and crack jokes, with no formality whatsoever or the need to guess what's going through the other person's mind...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Spooner', 3: "I suppose that's what family is like.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'Yes, exactly.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Enveloped by the lingering mountain fog, Hanying gazes at the place she once called "home."'}
{2: 'Hanying', 3: 'Let us carry on so we can go home.', 4: '1'}
